author: konmaorg
title: Cardano-Polkadot Oracle Bridge
description: There are no oracles in Cardano ecosystem to support cross chain interaction b/w Cardano and Polkadot ecosystem.

author: konmaorg
title: Haskell Bootcamp TPG X KONMA
description: As of May 2021, Haskell was the 28th most popular programming language by Google searches for tutorials, but made up less than 1% of active users on the GitHub source code repository.

author: ninhtran
title: ATALA Prism zKP + Hyperledger Aries
description: ATALA Prism and RootsID don't support zero-Knowledge Proofs and Predicates and are currently not interoperable with Hyperledger Aries or W3C OBv3. Prism is only on Testnet. Let's get ATALA on Mainnet.

author: danadak
title: ProofOfHumanity KYC on Atala Prism
description: Atala Prism—coupled with Roots ID—could benefit from a number of proof of humanity KYC solutions that add to a self-sovereign identity and enable true democracy (one person / one vote) within Cardano

author: brerrabbit3
title: Cardano/Ethereum NFT Ecosystems Map
description: We lack visual tools and research on the relationships between the Ethereum and Cardano NFT Ecosystems. What's similar between them? Which projects are most innovative? Where do we go from here?

author: ctin
title: TIP For Collaboration
description: An explosion of protocols, DApps, DEXs, NFTs and other artifacts of blockchain has led to an expanded attack surface for threat actors seeking to capitalize on victims in these ecosystems.

author: benzvibenjamin
title: Students for Blockchain
description: There is still not enough students aware and knowledgeable about blockchain technology

author: argentinianminer
title: MAYZ: Cardano Cross-Chain Index
description: The vast majority of crypto users don't have direct exposure to Cardano. Managing a well-diversified portfolio in a different ecosystem can be both time consuming and risky.

author: cryptoloops
title: Creating NFTs & Gaming Cross Chain!
description: The current problem is that there aren't any great methods or groups facilitating of interoperability of NFT ecosystems between the Cardano and other blockchains!

author: nick.odio
title: MultiSwap (X-Chain Swaps by Ferrum)
description: Secure multi-chain aggregators, interoperability protocols, & cross-chain swapping platforms connecting L1 solutions to both eUTXO and EVM compatible networks are non-existent in todays landscape.

author: monet
title: Cross-Chain NFT Cultivation Events
description: South African artists lack much-needed guidance to understand and create NFT art on the Blockchain and how to join the digital ecosystem.

author: lambertglen76
title: United Media BlockChain Community
description: The problem that United Media is here to fix is the lack of production, content creation, and documenting the crypto community. Bringing the point of views of those who are working on the blockchain

author: geekship
title: SOIL: OriginTrail / Ontochain (DKG)
description: A Decentralized Knowledge Graph is being developed by Origintrail, with integrations with Ethereum, Gnosis, Polygon, and recently Polkadot. Cardano should also be supported.

author: dreamcoin
title: BitFins Cross-Chain NFT Aquariums
description: Many projects developing in the NFT space lack a utility that can connect to the traditional world and the world becoming more digital means a need for bridging that gap is arising in many forms.

author: iagon
title: Automatic cross-chain token bridge
description: For the Iagon token bridge, the current process has to be split into two manual steps (instead of automatic): Ethereum to Milkomeda and Milkomeda to Cardano, which is not an ideal user experience.

author: ivankwananda
title: AMA with Cross-Chain Communities
description: There are many chains, but they build their own chain independently. We need to increase communication, coordination & collaboration between chains in Indonesia, so that we could learn from each other

author: jmo
title: Cross-Chain Card Game
description: Existing "on-chain" games lack interoperability and limit players to using a single block-chain.

author: keith
title: Job & Event Center (Woolly Map)
description: There is not a definitive spot to go in the Cardano ecosystem that enables people the ability to act instantly on events/jobs that are going on.

author: raz
title: The ArtSuite Multi-Chain NFT Events
description: Lack of a Cardano focused, hosted and structured events programme introducing artists, and catalysing multi chain and interoperable collaboration among NFT artists of all chains.

author: wolfram.blockchain.labs
title: Wolfram UTxO History&Collaboration
description: UTXO chains need to accelerate their collaborative efforts and remember their common origins

author: taxir
title: Taxir | Bringing Blockchain to MENA
description: We recognize a High Potential / Low Adoption paradox regarding blockchain in MENA (Middle East and North Africa). Adoption has been stagnant and use cases are narrow qualitatively and quantitatively.

author: dzhuliana
title: Growing Web3 Mentorship Pool
description: Blockchain communities operate in silos. How can we form meaningful connections across blockchains and web3 communities to promote greater collaboration?

author: dzhuliana
title: Cross-Chain Catalyst Women Activity
description: How do we ensure Cardano is leading the way for blockchains to meet the UN’s SDG goal for gender equity?

author: aharon
title: Catalyst+DAOstack Open Space
description: Many blockchain projects are located in Israel, which is known as the "start up nation", but lack of awareness to Cardano limits the potential for collaboration with the local community.

author: yeepeekoo
title: One Crypto Pass
description:
https://youtu.be/bziQe89lHLU  

Not your keys, not your coins, right?

But how can your seed phrases be kept safe? How will we onboard the next billion users on-chain without this FUD of getting hacked?

author: littlefish.foundation
title: littlefish - Ocean Technologies
description: Up-to-date, detailed information on cross-chain solutions, DAO enabling tools, and other technologies is difficult to reach. Opportunities to learn from others and collaborate never materialize.

author: littlefish.foundation
title: littlefish - Ocean Organizations
description: Up-to-date, detailed information on building decentralized organizations is hard to come by, often hidden deep within a DAO. Opportunities to learn and to collaborate never materialize.

author: ayaxlabombarda
title: Innovatio Cross-Chain ADA-AVAX-DOT
description: The technism of Cardano smart contracts, with Haskell/Plutus, doesn't attract most developers and entrepreneurs under Solidity standards, making adoption and cross-chain collaborations more difficult.

author: christianspeckhardt
title: Cardano for Impact Investors
description: SDG relevant Blockchain projects are not yet connected with the Impact Investment industry. There is no access to impact finance yet, across chains, and the sector is missing trust and credibility.

author: misterchaos42
title: everCrypt DAO|Basic Income Protocol
description: Climate change & COVID-19 continue to impact populations around the world, compounding existing inequalities & insecurities, while producing new economic, political, social and environmental fissures.

author: sebastiengllmt
title: Solve asset fractionalization
description: Multiple bridges connected to Milkomeda and Cardano result in the creation of multiple assets (derivatives) which fragment liquidity (of the same asset e.g. USDC) and impact UX in protocols.

author: crosschaincbtc
title: More secure cross-chain solutions
description: The problem is that cross-chain security issues still occur frequently, and users are concerned about the safety of cross-chain assets.

author: christianspeckhardt
title: Promoting Cardano for Impact
description: SDG Blockchain projects are not fully recognized outside of the Blockchain ecosystem. A disconnect between the Blockchain and the Impact industry is holding back credibility and scaling potential.

author: rootsid
title: RootsWallet - Aries JS
description: Hyperledger Aires is the most adopted framework for Identity projects. RootsID already delivered backend agents based on it, however RootsWallet, our mobile identity wallet, does not support it yet.

author: rootsid
title: KERI bridge for Cardano
description: KERI is a breakthrough technology considered to be the first truly decentralized identity system that is ledger-portable. Can Cardano be the first KERI Witness network on a major blockchain?

author: rootsid
title: Cardano SSI Contributors - Season 2
description: There is no Cardano/Prism/Catalyst open source identity project contributing to SSI standards interop/portability discussions except RootsID. The SSI community needs to know about Cardano identity.

author: gtcryptoant
title: Cardano Events Barcelona
description: Cardano has a reputation for being, an unwelcoming and closed ecosystem. This perception means other chains are chosen over Cardano to launch projects.

author: tosidrop
title: TosiDrop Cross-chain Development
description: Wide token distribution is fundamental for successful community-driven projects and decentralization. It is difficult, however, for projects to widely distribute tokens on both Cardano and Ergo.

author: silvia.ecclesia
title: United Nations Blockchain4Impact
description: The United Nations lack understanding on how blockchain can be used for achieving the SDGs and how to build partnerships with blockchain communities and startups.

author: latinstakepools
title: Onboard New Hispanic Ethereum Users
description: Misinformation and disinformation regarding Cardano in Ethereum communities, as well as lack of quality educational material in Spanish, creates barriers of entry to new Hispanic users and developers.

author: zoeselina
title: Catalyst Ticker on Twitter
description: There are many resources for Catalyst, but not a simple Ticker that provides the most important information. Communication is important, and it needs to be enhanced for better overviews and less FOMO.

author: sbpabon
title: Evescale Devs on Cardano
description: Japanese developers of the Everscale Blockchain and Japanese Cardano community see Gimbalabs' Plutus PBL as a good tool to learn how to develop in Cardano. However, it is only available in English.

author: dimabrook
title: NFT Bridge to & from Cardano
description:
At the moment, there's no reliable way to transfer NFTs to or from Cardano.
The existing bridges are FT focused.
Cardano based NFTs are behind an Iron Curtain cut out from the world markets.

author: headelf
title: C.S.E.R.DEFI
description: How can all Blockchains minimize potential staff & bad players predatory practices against vulnerable Senior Citizens globally with resulting bad press and potential government regulation pressures?

author: benzvibenjamin
title: United Caricature 2
description: There is not enough creative ways that connect between chains and unite them to grow mass adoption

author: darenft
title: NFT Game Marketplace Cross-Chain
description:
Cardano doesn't have a real marketplace for Gamefi on Cardano yet
The number of NFT games and gamers currently on Cardano is still not much
NFT games have the largest number of transactions on-chain.

author: raz
title: CrossChain Blockchain4Good Research
description: Connecting UN frameworks like the SDGs to Proposals require analyses + evaluation. Support our research work in Fund 9 as in Fund 6, 7 and 8. Comparative cross chain research is lacking.

author: quintin
title: Cross-Chain NFT Music Player
description: Music NFTs are not connected to Cardano from other blockchains like Ethereum, Polygon, and Harmony One.

author: rmbrt
title: Multi-chain token bridge
description: Cardano, like most blockchains, is currently isolated and only few solutions for bridges exist. Existing solutions are not extendable to new chains or require trust in its operators (can get hacked).

author: iamyashablack
title: Spectrum.Network | Layer 2 for DeFi
description: There's no direct access to the liquidity of other blockchains for dApps. Moreover, there's no decentralized way to transfer liquidity across different DeFi protocols. CEX is the only tool.

author: anetabtc
title: anetaBTC on Cardano and Ergo
description: We must have a protocol that unlocks the value of Bitcoin on Cardano to fully optimize Cardano DeFi potential.

author: max.zab
title: Decentralized cross-chain OTC
description: DAOs and token projects experience issues with attracting liquidity from other chains + often they need a channel to sell their token to a specific buyer in a agreed volume in BTC or stablecoins.

author: catalystswarm
title: Catalyst Swarm & SingularityNET
description: There is a massive lack of coordination, communication & collaboration between the Cardano & SingularityNET Communities to turn Cardano into the premier blockchain for AI services.

author: latamcardano
title: Empowering Collabs though Hubs
description: There aren't proper digital bridges between different Blockchain Communities to collaborate with one another

author: silvia.ecclesia
title: Climathon: Blockchain4Climate
description: Blockchain for climate action requires multi-disciplinary collaboration across communities: co-creation processes could enhance innovative solutions leveraging blockchain's transparency.

author: maximilian.rang
title: Sifchain Omni-EVM
description: There is currently no way to send tokens from Cardano to Cosmos or vice versa. This limits the flow of Cardano-native assets in the blockchain world as a whole.

author: neielv
title: Scrutiny System in blockchain
description: In several Latin American countries, the computer systems for counting votes are highly manipulable, not very auditable, not very transparent, not very reliable and do not allow citizens to be audited

author: muesliswap
title: Bridgeless atomic cross chain swaps
description: In order to transfer assets between Cardano and other blockchains, one needs a lot of steps involving an intermediary, which limits the accessibility of the Cardano ecosystem by the general public.

author: konmaorg
title: A Multi-chain Explorer ft. Cardano
description: There are multiple Cardano Explorers present but not one which can support multiple chains all at one place. This could bring in more users to the Cardano Ecosystem from the other chains.

author: adamrusch
title: IRI: Cross-Chain Happy Hours
description: We need more activities that allow Cardano Community members and general Crypto users to network and learn about the Cardano platform so they can better work together.

author: cole.vt
title: Positive Blockchain Database V2
description: There is not a user friendly way for people to learn about all the verified impact projects in the blockchain space.

author: tokenallies
title: Bringing Business to Cardano
description: Real world businesses have no easy access to Crypto Funding Capital

author: rod.g
title: Cardano Pilgrimage
description: Blockchain is a growing space with communities forming around different chains; many do not look upon Cardano favorably. More often than not it's due to misinformation and FUD, but it hurts Cardano.

author: imikushin
title: Oneiron: Cardano Sidechain SDK
description: To build a Cardano sidechain, a LOT of developer effort is needed. Most developers are not familiar with Plutus or even Haskell, but have experience with JVM-based languages or JavaScript.

author: nmkr
title: Crosschain Minting Solution
description: Non-Crypto-Native NFT collectors don't care about on which chain the NFT is stored. They just want to pay with their wallet and receive the NFT on their current chain.

author: konmaorg
title: Konma to bring in TRUTS on Cardano
description: Although Cardano has begun its adventure on being the go to place for DAOs and other community related ventures There's no platform or solution where you can find all these communities in one place.
